text: Black Opals was an African American literary magazine published in Philadelphia between spring 1927 and July 1928, associated with the Harlem Renaissance. Co-edited by Arthur Huff Fauset and Nellie Rathbone Bright, the magazine's contributors included Mae Virginia Cowdery, Jessie Redmon Fauset, Marita Bonner, and Gwendolyn B. Bennett. Allan Randall Freelon was the magazine's artistic director. ==References== Category:Magazines established in 1927 Category:Magazines disestablished in 1928 Category:1927 establishments in Pennsylvania Category:1928 disestablishments in Pennsylvania Category:Defunct literary magazines Category:Mass media in Philadelphia Category:African- American history in Philadelphia Category:Harlem Renaissance
title: Black Opals
